decks.notes: The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to utilize a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to stall out the game with defensive creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog while using spells like Spell Snare and Force of Negation to counter key threats. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Cling to Dust to deal with problematic creatures. Overall, the deck seeks to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent through careful resource management and strategic play.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using burn spells to push through damage. It also utilizes the companion mechanic with Jegantha, the Wellspring for additional value. The mana base is designed to support the three-color Mardu strategy, allowing for consistent access to all required colors. The inclusion of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Static Prison helps to control the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure on the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures, burn spells, and disruption tactics.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of graveyard recursion and sacrificing creatures to generate value and create a combo win condition with Marionette Apprentice. It aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize while setting up its own game plan with cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Unearth. The deck also includes cards like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler for additional recursion and creatures like Boggart Trawler and Warren Soultrader to help assemble the combo pieces. The mana base includes fetch lands and black sources to support the deck's requirements.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and countermagic to protect its combo pieces, primarily Goblin Charbelcher, in order to quickly assemble a winning combination without relying on traditional land drops. By utilizing cards like Disrupting Shoal, Fallaji Archaeologist, and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to control the game until it can deploy its combo pieces and win the game in a swift and explosive manner. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and manipulation spells like Preordain and Sea Gate Restoration to ensure consistency and smooth gameplay.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and control spells to lockdown the opponent while generating value and card advantage through Urza's abilities and various combos like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek. It also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for crucial artifacts and provide a way to win the game with the help of cards like Kaldra Compleat and Nettlecyst. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, generate a dominant board presence, and ultimately outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on assembling a specific combination of cards to win the game in a single turn. Phyrexian Unlife and Angel's Grace prevent you from losing the game, while Pact of Negation acts as protection. The key combo involves using Spoils of the Vault to find Thassa's Oracle and then using Thundertrap Trainer to draw your entire deck, ensuring that Thassa's Oracle's ability will win you the game. The deck also includes cards like Flare of Denial and The One Ring for additional control and card selection. The land base is designed to support the deck's strategy while providing the necessary colors for its spells.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly with cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Ruby Medallion to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot. The deck also includes cards like Wish and Past in Flames to search and recur key combo pieces. The goal is to build up a critical mass of spells to deal a large amount of damage in a single turn. The deck also includes cards like Questing Druid and Reckless Impulse to help dig for combo pieces and maintain card advantage.

The deck revolves around quickly generating mana using cards like Desperate Ritual and Ruby Medallion, casting spells like Flame of Anor and Ral, Monsoon Mage to deal damage, and utilizing Past in Flames to recast cards from the graveyard. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides an additional mana source and synergy with the deck. The goal is to cast a high number of spells in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent and finish them off with burn spells or creature damage. The deck focuses on fast, explosive combos to win the game quickly and decisively.
